exercises.name: Jumping Jacks
instructions: Stand with feet together and arms at your sides
Jump feet out wide while simultaneously raising arms overhead
Jump feet back together while lowering arms to sides
Repeat in a continuous rhythmic motion
cues: Land softly on the balls of your feet
Keep core engaged throughout
Maintain a steady breathing rhythm

exercises.name: Star Jumps
instructions: Start in a quarter squat position with arms at your sides
Explosively jump up, spreading arms and legs out to form a star shape
Land softly back in the starting quarter squat position
Immediately repeat
cues: Fully extend arms and legs at the peak of the jump
Absorb landing through bent knees
Drive through the balls of your feet

exercises.name: High Knees
instructions: Stand tall with feet hip-width apart
Drive one knee up toward chest while hopping on the opposite foot
Quickly alternate legs in a running motion
Pump arms in opposition to legs
cues: Bring knees to hip height or higher
Stay on the balls of your feet
Keep chest up and core tight

exercises.name: Butt Kickers
instructions: Stand tall with feet hip-width apart
Jog in place, kicking heels up toward your glutes
Alternate legs rapidly
Keep arms pumping naturally
cues: Try to tap your glutes with each heel
Keep knees pointing down, not forward
Maintain an upright posture

exercises.name: Jump Squats
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
Lower into a squat position, thighs parallel to floor
Explosively jump up, extending through hips, knees, and ankles
Land softly and immediately descend into the next squat
cues: Swing arms to generate momentum
Land with soft knees to absorb impact
Keep chest up throughout the movement

exercises.name: Squat Jacks
instructions: Start in a squat position with feet together and hands at chest
Jump feet out wide while staying in the squat position
Jump feet back together
Maintain the squat depth throughout
cues: Stay low in the squat the entire time
Keep weight in your heels
Engage your core for stability

exercises.name: Skaters
instructions: Stand on one leg with a slight bend in the knee
Leap laterally to the opposite side, landing on the other foot
Swing the trailing leg behind the landing leg
Immediately leap back to the other side
cues: Push off through the ball of your foot
Land softly with knee tracking over toes
Use arms for balance and momentum

exercises.name: Tuck Jumps
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
Jump explosively upward
At the peak, pull both knees toward your chest
Extend legs and land softly, immediately jumping again
cues: Drive arms up to increase jump height
Tuck knees as high as possible
Land with soft knees and absorb the impact

exercises.name: Sprint in Place
instructions: Stand in a running stance with one foot slightly forward
Drive knees up rapidly while pumping arms
Move as fast as possible while staying in place
Maintain the sprint for the designated time
cues: Stay on the balls of your feet
Drive elbows back forcefully
Keep core tight and chest up

exercises.name: Marching in Place
instructions: Stand tall with feet hip-width apart
Lift one knee to hip height while keeping foot flexed
Lower and repeat with the opposite leg
Swing arms naturally in opposition to legs
cues: Keep one foot on the ground at all times
Maintain an upright posture
Engage your core throughout

exercises.name: Jump Rope (Basic)
instructions: Hold rope handles at hip height with elbows close to body
Swing rope overhead and jump as it passes under feet
Land softly on the balls of your feet
Keep jumps small and controlled
cues: Use wrists to turn the rope, not shoulders
Jump just high enough to clear the rope
Keep core engaged and posture upright

exercises.name: Double Unders
instructions: Start with a basic jump rope rhythm
Jump higher than normal while spinning rope twice under feet
Land softly and immediately prepare for the next rep
Maintain a consistent rhythm
cues: Spin wrists faster, not arms
Jump straight up, not forward
Keep body tight and compact in the air

exercises.name: Battle Rope Waves
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding rope ends
Maintain a quarter squat with core braced
Alternate raising and lowering arms to create waves in the ropes
Keep waves continuous and powerful
cues: Generate power from your core and hips
Keep shoulders down and back
Maintain athletic stance throughout

exercises.name: Battle Rope Slams
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding both rope ends
Raise both arms overhead simultaneously
Slam the ropes down forcefully into the ground
Immediately raise and repeat
cues: Use your whole body to generate force
Engage core on the slam
Exhale forcefully with each slam

exercises.name: Box Jumps
instructions: Stand facing a plyo box at arm's length distance
Drop into a quarter squat and swing arms back
Explosively jump onto the box, landing with both feet
Stand fully, then step down and repeat
cues: Land softly with knees bent
Land with full feet on the box, not just toes
Step down rather than jumping to save your joints

exercises.name: Box Step Ups
instructions: Stand facing a plyo box or step
Step up with one foot, driving through the heel
Bring the other foot up to stand on the box
Step down and alternate leading leg
cues: Keep chest up and core engaged
Drive through the heel of the stepping leg
Control the descent

exercises.name: Treadmill Intervals
instructions: Warm up at a comfortable walking pace for 2-3 minutes
Increase speed to a challenging run for 30-60 seconds
Reduce speed to recovery pace for 60-90 seconds
Repeat intervals for desired duration
cues: Use the handrails only for safety, not support
Maintain proper running form throughout
Adjust speed based on your fitness level

exercises.name: Treadmill Incline Walk
instructions: Set treadmill to a steep incline (10-15%)
Walk at a moderate pace (2.5-3.5 mph)
Maintain upright posture without holding rails
Continue for desired duration
cues: Lean slightly forward from the ankles
Take shorter, quicker steps
Squeeze glutes with each step

exercises.name: Rowing Machine
instructions: Sit on the rower with feet secured in footplates
Grab handle with overhand grip, arms extended
Drive through legs first, then lean back slightly and pull handle to lower chest
Return by extending arms, hinging forward, then bending knees
cues: Sequence: legs, back, arms on the drive; arms, back, legs on recovery
Keep core braced throughout
Drive through heels, not toes

exercises.name: Assault Bike
instructions: Adjust seat height so leg is slightly bent at bottom of pedal stroke
Grip handles and begin pedaling while pushing and pulling arms
Coordinate arm and leg movements for maximum power
Maintain steady rhythm or vary intensity for intervals
cues: Push and pull handles actively
Keep core engaged for power transfer
Breathe rhythmically with your cadence

exercises.name: Stair Climber
instructions: Step onto the machine and select your desired speed
Begin stepping with a full range of motion
Use handrails lightly for balance only
Maintain consistent pace for desired duration
cues: Drive through your whole foot, not just toes
Keep chest up and avoid leaning on rails
Take deep, full steps

exercises.name: Elliptical Trainer
instructions: Step onto the pedals and grip the moving handles
Begin a smooth elliptical motion with your legs
Push and pull handles to engage upper body
Adjust resistance and incline as needed
cues: Keep feet flat on pedals
Maintain upright posture
Engage core throughout the movement

exercises.name: Stationary Bike
instructions: Adjust seat height so leg is slightly bent at bottom of pedal stroke
Begin pedaling at a comfortable cadence
Adjust resistance to increase difficulty
Maintain consistent pace or vary for intervals
cues: Keep knees tracking over toes
Maintain a neutral spine
Avoid rocking hips side to side

exercises.name: Step Touches
instructions: Stand with feet together
Step to the right with right foot
Bring left foot to meet right foot
Step to the left and repeat, alternating sides
cues: Keep one foot on the ground at all times
Add arm movements to increase intensity
Maintain a slight bend in the knees

exercises.name: Low Impact Jacks
instructions: Stand with feet together and arms at sides
Step right foot out while raising arms overhead
Step right foot back in while lowering arms
Alternate stepping out with left foot
cues: Keep one foot planted at all times
Move at a brisk pace for cardio benefit
Coordinate arm and leg movements

exercises.name: Mountain Climbers
instructions: Start in a high plank position with hands under shoulders
Drive one knee toward your chest
Quickly switch legs, driving the other knee forward
Continue alternating in a running motion
cues: Keep hips level, avoid bouncing
Maintain a straight line from head to heels
Drive knees toward opposite elbow for more oblique engagement

exercises.name: Burpees
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
Drop into a squat and place hands on floor
Jump feet back to plank position, perform a push-up
Jump feet forward, then explosively jump up with arms overhead
cues: Move fluidly through each phase
Land softly on each jump
Scale by removing push-up or jump as needed
